summary: A letter written to Judge Alison I. Nathan on December 1, 2020, in support of Ghislaine Maxwell. The author, a friend of Maxwell for over 25 years, describes her as providing free housing out of kindness and loyalty, asserts her moral character, and emphasizes her right to due process and humane treatment while presumed innocent.

persons.name: Alison I. Nathan
persons.context: The letter is addressed to her as the presiding judge in Ghislaine Maxwell's case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the letter; the author defends her character, describes her providing free housing, and asserts her innocence regarding the charges against her.

connections.description: Friends for over 25 years; Maxwell provided the author with free housing during a difficult time.

events.title: Letter of Support for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An unnamed friend writes a letter to Judge Alison Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's character and right to due process.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The author is a friend of Ghislaine Maxwell for over 25 years.
Maxwell provided the author with free housing when the author had nothing to offer in return.
The author strongly asserts Maxwell's moral character, specifically her loyalty and kindness.
The author states a belief in Maxwell's innocence regarding the charges against her and emphasizes her right to due process and humane treatment.
